alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 18 at 7:45PM MDT until April 19 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Wednesday and Thursday will see a prolonged period of widespread critical fire weather conditions with strong southwest to northwest winds, very low humidity and an unstable atmosphere. Several consecutive hours of single digit humidity values expected Wednesday over eastern New Mexico and the Middle Rio Grande Valley with poor overnight humidity recovery. Widespread critical fire weather conditions will persist into Thursday with prolonged single digit humidity favoring areas along and south of I-40, but temperatures will be cooler than normal area wide. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), and North Central Mountains (Zone 120) below significant snowpack from 10 AM to 10 PM MDT Wednesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
